Insurance industry advocacy group Americ: s Health Insurance Plans (AHIP) insists Advantage plans faced cuts of about 6 percent, after a combination of sequestration, a reduction in subsidies, the elimination of bonuses the government paid for quality plans, and Obamacare’s tax on premiums.
AHIP: commissioned report from February 2013 stated that Medicare Advantage patients could potentially face premium increases and benefit reductions in 2014 that would cost $50 to $90 a month.
